Why did the gray metal cube move?
options: Because the cyan rubber cylinder was present.
Because the red rubber sphere was present.
Because the brown rubber cylinder moved toward the gray metal cube.
Because the gray rubber cylinder moved toward the gray metal cube.
Because the gray metal cube moved spontaneously.

If we force the gray rubber cylinder not to move toward the gray metal cube, will the brown rubber cylinder cause the gray metal cube to move?

If the gray rubber cylinder had not moved toward the gray metal cube, would the gray metal cube still have moved?
Was the fact that the brown rubber cylinder moved toward the gray metal cube sufficient for the gray metal cube to move?
Was the fact that the gray rubber cylinder moved toward the gray metal cube sufficient for the gray metal cube to move?
Was the fact that the brown rubber cylinder moved toward the gray metal cube necessary for the gray metal cube to move?
Was the fact that the gray rubber cylinder moved toward the gray metal cube necessary for the gray metal cube to move?
What is the actual cause of the gray metal cube moving?
options: The red rubber sphere is present.
The gray rubber cylinder moves toward the gray metal cube.
The brown rubber cylinder moves toward the gray metal cube.
The cyan rubber cylinder is present.

qa_pairs.question: Was the fact that the brown rubber cylinder moved toward the gray metal cube responsible for the gray metal cube moving?
Was the fact that the gray rubber cylinder moved toward the gray metal cube responsible for the gray metal cube moving?
